body_html:
Thanks. I did check and found I posted some wrong information.

tensorboard in /bin of Python 3.4 virtualenv works, its the tensorboard installed along with Anaconda (Python 3.5.1) that doesn't.

what I did:

pip3 install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow-0.7.1-cp34-none-linux_x86_64.whl

Probably this .whl installation is not meant for Anaconda.

what I did:

body:
Thanks. I did check and found I posted some wrong information.

`tensorboard` in `/bin` of `Python 3.4 virtualenv` works, its the `tensorboard` installed along with Anaconda (Python 3.5.1) that doesn't. 

what I did:

```
pip3 install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow-0.7.1-cp34-none-linux_x86_64.whl
```

Probably this `.whl` installation is not meant for Anaconda.
